ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The importance of art and humanities during the end of the world! Our doomed world needs ideas and arts more than ever.
Research, development and close reading of apocalyptic narrative texts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Good discussion and cool texts to explore different sides to apocalypse fiction and imagining the end of the world. I do think the readings got to be a lot some weeks, and if you aren't interested in the book it can be a grind to get through and be engaged.

This class is extremely interesting - certainly one of the most interesting lit classes at Yale. The papers are very open so you can focus on a topic that really interests you. The only critique I have of this class is that the professor is an extremely harsh grader. Otherwise super cool class.

I think there are so many fascinating apocalyptic narratives in modern movies, TV shows, and books that I also would have liked to focus on in this class. The content we covered was interesting, but could be a slog to get through at times.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Cool way to imagine the end of the world and see the importance of art and humanities when looking at global catastrophe. Readings can get to be a lot week by week and paper are completely open/no prompt so you have to actively engage to get anything out of the course. But worth it if you do!
I would recommend this course if you want to read a lot and you're interested in the subject, however it is not an easy class.
Yes! Very interesting discussions in this class.
